DOC.brief_title: Dispervise Ophthalmic Viscoelastic Agent Ensure Watertight Wound Closure After Clear Corneal Cataract Incisions
DOC.criteria: Ability provide inform consent , complete questionnaire , likely complete visit Subject must male female , race , least 21 year old Undergoing uncomplicated cataract surgery clear corneal incision Subjects known sensitivity inappropriate responsiveness medication use postoperative course Acute chronic disease illness would increase risk confound study result ( e.g. , uncontrolled diabetes mellitus , immunocompromised , etc . ) Uncontrolled systemic disease Corneal abnormality ( e.g. , stromal , epithelial endothelial dystrophy ) Subjects use concurrent topical systemic medication may impair heal , include limited : antimetabolite , isotretinoin ( Accutane ) within 6 month treatment , amiodarone hydrochloride ( Cordarone ) within 12 month treatment Subjects history follow medical condition , condition could affect wound healing : collagen vascular disease , autoimmune disease , immunodeficiency disease , ocular herpes zoster simplex , endocrine disorder ( include limit unstable thyroid disorder diabetes ) , lupus , rheumatoid arthritis Concurrent participation participation last 30 day clinical trial
